page.title: 02NATURAL FEATURES, BLEASDALE
page.content:
Most of the farm land is used for grazing and meadow land.
The extreme East of the area is very steep and used for rough grazing.The hills in the East are Parlick Fell, Blindhurst Fell and Fairsnape Fell. They are covered mainly with bracken, rushes and heather.
Quite a lot of conifers have been planted and there is deciduous woodland around the River Brock and around peoples homes.Also there are many rhododendron bushes in the woods.
The River Brock has two sources one rising on Fairsnape Fell and the other on Blindhurst Fell.The Winsnape Brook and Clough Head Brook are tributaries of the River Brock.
